meanings.definition: Make a quick, nervous movement of the face or body as an instinctive reaction to surprise, fear, or pain.
meanings.sent1: She would flinch whenever a loud noise startled her.
meanings.sent2: I flinched when the unexpected fireworks went off.
meanings.sent3: The cat would flinch comically whenever someone sneezed loudly.
meanings.sent4: His heart would flinch at the thought of losing his best friend.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's body would flinch involuntarily at the sound of gunfire.

meanings.definition: Show sudden movement or hesitation in response to something unpleasant or startling.
meanings.sent1: He couldn't help but flinch when the horror movie suddenly got scary.
meanings.sent2: The horse would flinch at the sight of the snake on the trail.
meanings.sent3: The audience would flinch in surprise as the magician made the rabbit disappear.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence would flinch momentarily when faced with a difficult question.
meanings.sent5: The child would flinch at the sight of the creepy crawly spider.
